Detailed Description

Displays a robot scene graph via OSG.

Member Function Documentation

bool brics_3d::rsg::OSGVisualizer::addGeometricNode ( unsigned int  parentId,
unsigned int &  assignedId,
vector< Attribute >  attributes,
Shape::ShapePtr  shape,
TimeStamp  timeStamp,
bool  forcedId = false 
) [virtual]

Add a GeometricNode that contains 3D data to the robot scene graph.

Parameters:
[in]parentIdID of the parent node. To add more more parents use the brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate::addParent() function.
[in,out]assignedIdThe ID that was assigned internally. In case the forcedId flag has been set to true it will used instead of the internal ID assignment. Use this functio with care. There are are some internal checks if the manually assigned is valid but do not rely on this in a distibuted setting.
[in]attributesA set of attributs that will be set for the node.
shapeThe geometic Shape to be contained the the GeometricNode. Multiple shape types are possible like a Box, a Cylinder a Mesh or a PointCloud for instance.
timeStampTime stamp assiciated with the geometic Shape.
forcedIdIf set to true the ID defined in assignedId will be taken instead of an intanally generated one. This is in particular useful if distibuted scene graphs propagate updates and ensures IDs are not re-created.
Returns:
True if a new GeometricNode was sucessfully added to the scen egraph.

Implements brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate.

Definition at line 232 of file OSGVisualizer.cpp.

bool brics_3d::rsg::OSGVisualizer::addGroup ( unsigned int  parentId,
unsigned int &  assignedId,
vector< Attribute >  attributes,
bool  forcedId = false 
) [virtual]

Add a Group node to the robot scenegraph.

The group allows to create the graph structure as it has children, in contrast to a simple node.

Parameters:
[in]parentIdID of the parent node. To add more more parents use the brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate::addParent() function.
[in,out]assignedIdThe ID that was assigned internally. In case the forcedId flag has been set to true it will used instead of the internal ID assignment. Use this functio with care. There are are some internal checks if the manually assigned is valid but do not rely on this in a distibuted setting.
[in]attributesA set of attributs that will be set for the node.
[in]forcedIdIf set to true the ID defined in assignedId will be taken instead of an intanally generated one. This is in particular useful if distibuted scene graphs propagate updates and ensures IDs are not re-created.
Returns:
True if a new Group was sucessfully added to the scene graph.

Implements brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate.

bool  forcedId = false

[in]attributesA set of attributs that will be set for the node.
[in]forcedIdIf set to true the ID defined in assignedId will be taken instead of an intanally generated one. This is in particular useful if distibuted scene graphs propagate updates and ensures IDs are not re-created.

Definition at line 387 of file OSGVisualizer.cpp.

bool brics_3d::rsg::OSGVisualizer::addTransformNode ( unsigned int  parentId,
unsigned int &  assignedId,
vector< Attribute >  attributes,
IHomogeneousMatrix44::IHomogeneousMatrix44Ptr  transform,
TimeStamp  timeStamp,
bool  forcedId = false 
) [virtual]

Add a new Transform node the the robot scene graph.

Internally brics_3d::rsg::Transform is used that is able to maintain a temporal cache of the trnasform data.

Parameters:
[in]parentIdID of the parent node. To add more more parents use the brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate::addParent() function.
[in,out]assignedIdThe ID that was assigned internally. In case the forcedId flag has been set to true it will used instead of the internal ID assignment. Use this functio with care. There are are some internal checks if the manually assigned is valid but do not rely on this in a distibuted setting.
[in]attributesA set of attributs that will be set for the node.
transformThe actual transform data that will be (initially) inserted. You can later insert more with brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate::setTransform() .
timeStampTime stamp associated with the transform.
forcedIdIf set to true the ID defined in assignedId will be taken instead of an intanally generated one. This is in particular useful if distibuted scene graphs propagate updates and ensures IDs are not re-created.
Returns:
True if a new Transform was sucessfully added to the scene graph.

Implements brics_3d::rsg::ISceneGraphUpdate.
